#Text=Muhammad Ibrahim Bilal
#Text=Muhammad Ibrahim Bilal was a member of a terrorist group dubbed the Portland Seven , some members of which attempted to travel to Afghanistan shortly after 9/11 in order to aid the Taliban .
#Text=In October 2002 , Bilal was indicted and shortly thereafter arrested in Detroit .
#Text=In 2003 , he was sentenced to eight years on gun charges and for conspiracy to aid the Taliban in fighting the United States and coalition forces .
#Text=Muhammad Bilal and the Portland Seven

#Text=Patrice Lumumba Ford , Jeffrey Leon Battle , October Martinique Lewis ( Battle 's ex-wife ) , Muhammad Ibrahim Bilal , his brother Ahmed Ibrahim Bilal , Maher " Mike " Hawash , and Habis Abdulla al Saoub made up the original seven members wanted by the FBI .
#Text=According to the FBI , in plea agreements Muhammad and Ahemed Bilal admitted to engaging in martial arts and firearms in order to prepare themselves for jihad in Afghanistan or elsewhere :

#Text=Both defendants [ Muhammad and Ahmed Bilal ] admit that on Oct. 20 , 2001 , while U.S. military forces were fighting al Qaeda and the Taliban in Afghanistan , co-defendant Maher Hawash took them and co-defendant Ford to the airport in Portland , where they flew to Hong Kong to meet with others .
#Text=In the plea agreement , both defendants state that they entered into mainland China , went to Kashgar in Western China , and tried , unsuccessfully , to gain entrance into Pakistan . [ 1 ]
#Text=On September 29 , 2001 , Battle , Ford and al Saoub were discovered while engaged in shooting practice in a gravel pit in Skamania County , Washington .
#Text=Also present was Ali Khalid Steitiye , who did not become an indicted member of the Portland Seven on terrorism charges , but who was separately charged with other crimes .
#Text=According to the indictment , on October 17 , 2001 , Battle and al Saoub flew out of Portland International Airport en route to Afghanistan .
#Text=On October 20 , 2001 , Ford and the two Bilals also took the same route out of the United States .
#Text=M. Bilal returned to the U.S. on or about December 24 , 2001 .
#Text=The six male members of the group travelled to China in early 2002 , with the intent of entering Afghanistan to aid the Taliban .
#Text=Lacking visas and other documentation , they were turned back , and all but al Saoub then returned again to the United States .

#Text=On Thursday , October 3 , 2002 , a federal grand jury in United States District Court for the District of Oregon , at Portland , Oregon , indicted Battle , Ford , the two Bilals , al Saoub and Lewis .
#Text=On October 4 , 2002 the FBI in Portland , Oregon announced the arrest of four of those original six on charges of aiding and , in some cases , trying to join Al-Qaida fighters .
#Text=Battle , Ford and Lewis were all arrested that morning in Portland .
#Text=Muhammad Bilal was arrested at the same time by the FBI in Dearborn , Michigan . [ 2 ]
#Text=Sentencing
#Text=Ford and Battle are each serving eighteen-year sentences .
#Text=Lewis was sentenced to three years in a federal prison camp .
#Text=Ahmed Bilal got ten years .
#Text=Hawash was sentenced to seven years .
#Text=Muhammad was sentenced to eight years and was released from prison on September 22 , 2009 .
#Text=Muhammad Bilal 's lawyer , Andrew Bates , described Bilal as an " " ordinary young man " and a " gentle soul " whose mission to Afghanistan was a " misadventure .
